designSystem.name: Dark Glass UI
designSystem.description: A dark-themed design system featuring glassmorphic panels, vibrant accent colors, and soft visual effects.

primary.description: Primary dark background for the entire application canvas.
For main headings, labels, and primary button text.

secondary.description: For body copy, descriptions, and placeholder text.

disabled.description: For text labels in a disabled or inactive state.

primary.description: Main accent color for primary actions, links, and selected states.

positive.description: For positive states, such as the 'on' state of a toggle.

panel.description: Base background for cards and panels. Requires a backdrop-filter for the glass effect.

panelBorder.description: Subtle border for glass panels to simulate a highlighted edge.

interactive.description: Background for secondary buttons and selected segmented controls.

interactiveSubtle.description: Background for tertiary elements like icon-only button containers.

panel.description: Soft, deep shadow to lift panels off the background.

thumb.description: Subtle shadow for interactive elements like slider and switch thumbs.

sliderFill.description: Gradient for the filled portion of a slider track.

iconOnly.context: Tertiary actions in a row, e.g., 'Reply', 'Flag'

misapplicationRules.title: Style Application Constraints (DO NOT rules)
rules: DO NOT apply panel shadows ('effects.shadows.panel') to small components like buttons or icons.
DO NOT apply gradients to button backgrounds or icon fills; gradients are reserved for specific uses like slider fills.
DO NOT use accent colors (primary, destructive) for large background areas; they are for interactive elements only.
DO NOT apply the panel border ('palette.ui.panelBorder') to any element other than the main card/panel containers.
DO NOT use secondary text color ('palette.text.secondary') for interactive elements like button labels; it's for non-interactive descriptions.
DO NOT place icons inside primary/secondary/destructive buttons. Those buttons use text labels only.
DO NOT use the pressed inner shadow effect ('effects.shadows.pressed') on default-state elements; it is exclusively for active/selected states.
